prd.title: What is a PRD?
prd.desc: A spec document that AI reads before coding.
prd.desc_2: With a PRD, AI knows exactly "what to build" and helps you accurately.
prd.without_desc: AI guesses and builds something. Password reset? Social login? Skipped.
prd.with_example: AI reads PRD and implements exactly
prd.with_desc: "Email login, password reset, Google OAuth" - all included. Nothing missed.
prd.key_point: PRD = AI's work order. Clear instructions, clear results.

problem.title: Why does AI coding keep going wrong?
problem.problem_1_desc: "Build login" - Password reset? Social login? Silently omitted.
problem.problem_2_title: Jumps straight to coding, skipping design
problem.problem_2_desc: No architecture thinking - straight to code - full refactor later.
problem.problem_3_title: Results vary every time, debugging explodes
problem.problem_3_desc: Same prompt, different results yesterday vs today - 2-3 days debugging hell.
problem.conclusion: That's why PRD should be a 'gate', not an 'option'.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Does it force a specific PRD format?
faq.a1: We provide templates, but don't force them. Just need required sections (goals, scope, requirements).
faq.q2: Can I use my own PRD template?
faq.a2: Yes. Use your existing template as-is. Clouvel just gates on document "existence", not specific format.
faq.a3: License activation needs internet once. After that, works fully offline.
faq.q4: How does it fit my existing workflow?
faq.a4: It's an MCP server - just add config to Claude Code/Desktop. Doesn't touch your code or project structure.
faq.q5: Why not just use a prompt or CLAUDE.md?
faq.a5: A prompt is a "request". A gate is a "rule". Requests can be ignored. Gates either pass or block. Rules create consistency.
